data.chText: 可选择的事物；选择；选择权；选择的自由
data.enText: something that you can choose to have or do; the freedom to choose what you do

data.chText: 据我看，我们有两种选择…
data.enText: As I see it, we have two options…

data.chText: 你有多种选择。
data.enText: There are various options open to you.

data.chText: 上大学不是我可以选择的道路。
data.enText: Going to college was not an option for me.

data.chText: 我别无选择，只有请他离开。
data.enText: I had no option but to (= I had to) ask him to leave.

data.chText: 学生在二年级时可以选择出国学习。
data.enText: Students have the option of studying abroad in their second year.

data.chText: 一项允许你每月自由存款的储蓄方案。
data.enText: A savings plan that gives you the option to vary your monthly payments.

data.chText: 这一种型号的货品有很多选择。
data.enText: This particular model comes with a wide range of options (= things you can choose to have when buying sth but which you will have to pay extra for) .

data.chText: 选修课
data.enText: a subject that a student can choose to study, but that they do not have to do

data.chText: 这一学程开了设计和计算机技术的选修科目。
data.enText: The course offers options in design and computing.

data.chText: （未来的）买卖选择权
data.enText: the right to buy or sell sth at some time in the future

data.chText: 我们有权购买这所房子。
data.enText: We have an option on the house.

data.chText: 这房子供出租，但可随时买下。
data.enText: The property is for rent with an option to buy at any time.

data.chText: 他答应我可以优先买他的汽车。
data.enText: He has promised me first option on his car (= the opportunity to buy it before anyone else) .

data.chText: 认股选择权
data.enText: share options (= the right to buy shares in a company)

data.chText: 选项；选择
data.enText: one of the choices you can make when using a computer program

data.chText: 从编辑选单上选“剪切”项。
data.enText: Choose the ‘Cut’ option from the Edit menu.
keep/leave your options open

data.chText: 保留选择余地；暂不决定
data.enText: to avoid making a decision now so that you still have a choice in the future
the soft/easy option

data.chText: 轻松的选择；捷径
data.enText: a choice which is thought to be easier because it involves less effort, difficulty, etc.

data.chText: 他们盼望新办法不会被视为捷径。
data.enText: They are anxious that the new course should not be seen as a soft option.

data.chText: 他决定顺水推舟，他们要什么就给什么。
data.enText: He decided to take the easy option and give them what they wanted.

data.chText: 以上各词均指某种情况下的选择。
data.enText: These are all words for sth that you choose to do in a particular situation.
option

data.chText: 指可选择的事物、选择、选择权、选择的自由：
data.enText: something that you can choose to have or do; the freedom to choose what you do

data.chText: 据我看，我们有两种选择…
data.enText: As I see it, we have two options…

data.chText: 学生在二年级时可以选择出国学习。
data.enText: Students have the option of studying abroad in their second year.

data.chText: option亦指计算机程序里的选项、选择：
data.enText: Option is also the word used in computing for one of the choices you can make when using a computer program.

data.chText: 从编辑选单上选择“剪切”项。
data.enText: Choose the ‘Cut’ option from the Edit menu.
choice

data.chText: 指选择权、选择的自由、选择、可选择的事物：
data.enText: the freedom to choose what you do; something that you can choose to have or do

data.chText: 如果让我选择，我明天就停止工作。
data.enText: If I had the choice, I would stop working tomorrow.

data.chText: 你有很大的选择余地。
data.enText: There is a wide range of choices open to you.
alternative

data.chText: 指可供选择的事物、其中一种选择：
data.enText: something that you can choose to have or do out of two or more possibilities

data.chText: 你的工资可以按周以现金支取，或按月以支票支取。二者可选其一。
data.enText: You can be paid in cash weekly or by cheque monthly: those are the two alternatives.

data.chText: 用option、choice还是alternative？
choice较option稍非正式，而alternative更正式些。表示选择权或选择的自由最常用choice，不过有时也可用option，但通常不用alternative：
data.enText: Choice is slightly less formal than option and alternative is slightly more formal. Choice is most often used for ‘the freedom to choose’, although you can sometimes also use option (but not usually alternative ).

data.chText: 如果让我选择，我会…
data.enText: If I had the choice/option, I would…
If I had the alternative, I would…

data.chText: 父母在教育方面的选择权
data.enText: parental choice in education
parental option/alternative in education

data.chText: 表示可选择的事物用option、choice或alternative均可。不过，alternative较常用以指两项而非多项之间的选择。
data.enText: Things that you can choose are options , choices or alternatives . However, alternative is more frequently used to talk about choosing between two things rather than several.
option, choice or alternative?
possibility

data.chText: 指某种情况下可选择的事物：
data.enText: one of the different things that you can do in a particular situation

data.chText: 我们需要探究各种可能的情况。
data.enText: We need to explore a wide range of possibilities.

data.chText: 可想的办法是无穷的。
data.enText: The possibilities are endless.

data.chText: possibility的用法与option、choice和alternative相似，不过，其重点主要在于可选择的事物而非需要作出选择。
data.enText: Possibility can be used in a similar way to option , choice and alternative , but the emphasis here is less on the need to make a choice, and more on what is available.
with/without the option/choice/possibility of sth
a(n) good/acceptable/reasonable/possible option/choice/alternative
the only option/choice/alternative/possibility open to sb
your best option/alternative (is to…)
to have a(n)/the option/choice of doing sth
to have no option/choice/alternative ( but to do sth)
a number/range of options/choices/alternatives/possibilities
not much option/choice

simple_means.memory_skill: opt 选择 + ion 表动作 → 选择

ex.zh: 选择一个选项；选择选修课

data.enText: keep/leave your options open

data.chText: 保留选择余地；暂不决定
data.enText: to avoid making a decision now so that you still have a choice in the future
the soft/easy option

data.chText: 轻松的选择；捷径
data.enText: a choice which is thought to be easier because it involves less effort, difficulty, etc.

data.chText: 他们盼望新办法不会被视为捷径。
data.enText: They are anxious that the new course should not be seen as a soft option.

data.chText: 他决定顺水推舟，他们要什么就给什么。
data.enText: He decided to take the easy option and give them what they wanted.

tr: the act of choosing or selecting
example: your choice of colors was unfortunate

tr: one of a number of things from which only one can be chosen
example: my only choice is to refuse

tr: the right to buy or sell property at an agreed price
the right is purchased and if it is not exercised by a stated date the money is forfeited

value.def: An option is something that you can choose to do in preference to one or more alternatives.

example.ex: He's argued from the start that America and its allies are putting too much emphasis on the military option...
example.tran: 他从一开始就认为美国及其盟国过于强调军事手段。

example.ex: What other options do you have?
example.tran: 你还有什么别的选择吗？

value.def: If you have the option of doing something, you can choose whether to do it or not.

example.ex: Criminals are given the option of going to jail or facing public humiliation...
example.tran: 罪犯可以选择要么坐牢，要么遭受当众羞辱。

example.ex: We had no option but to abandon the meeting.
example.tran: 我们别无选择，只有放弃这次会面。

value.def: In business, an option is an agreement or contract that gives someone the right to buy or sell something such as property or shares at a future date.

example.ex: Each bank has granted the other an option on 19.9% of its shares.
example.tran: 两家银行都同意给予对方其19.9%股份的期权。

value.def: An option is one of a number of subjects which a student can choose to study as a part of his or her course.

example.ex: Several options are offered for the student's senior year.
example.tran: 为毕业班学生开设了几门选修课。

value.def: If you keep your options open or leave your options open, you delay making a decision about something.

example.ex: I am keeping my options open. I have not made a decision on either matter.
example.tran: 我保留选择权，这两件事我都还没有作出决定。

value.tran: 暂不作决定；保留选择权

value.def: If you take the soft option, you do the thing that is easiest or least likely to cause trouble in a particular situation.

example.ex: We take the soft option. I like to keep the crowd happy because that's what they pay for...
example.tran: 我们决定采取最保险的方案。我希望让观众开心，因为他们就是为这个掏钱的。

example.ex: The job of chairman can no longer be regarded as a convenient soft option.
example.tran: 别再以为董事长这份工作是那么容易做的。

value.tran: 最容易的选择；最保险的选择

trans: 看跌期權；看跌；看跌期权；卖出期权；卖权
（在合同期限内）按议定价购买股份权；购买选择权
期权定价理论；期权定价模型；的期权定价模型；选择权定价模式；选择权定价模型
选择权契约，有选择权的合同，期权合同
股票期权，认股选择权(让员工可按固定价格购买所属公司的股票)
优先购买权；优先认购权
最容易的选择；最保险的选择
欧式期权；欧洲期权；欧式选择权
不得不，被迫，除…之外别无他法
配置选项；选择配置选项；配置参数；设定；设备参数

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 加强 + opt 选择 → 一再通过选择 → 采纳
adopt 采纳；收养 + able 可…的，能…的；具有…性质的 → 可采纳的
adopt 采纳；收养 + ive …的 → 采用的
opt 选择 + ion 表动作 → 选择
option 选择 + al …的 → 可选择的
opt 视力；光 + ic …的 → 眼的，视力的
opt 视力；光 + ician 表人 → 眼镜商
opt 视力；光 + ics …学 → 光学
opto〔= opt〕视力；光 + meter 测量计 → 视力计
opto 视力 + metr〔= meter〕测量计 + ist 从事某职业的人 → 验光师
